line-height: 200%;">}</span></strong></span></p></td><td style="width: 93.55pt; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt; height: 27.0pt;" width="125"><p class="CM11" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The State </span></strong></span></p><p class="CM11" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; line-height: 110%;"> </p><p align="right" class="CM11" style="text-align: right; line-height: 110%; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt -.7pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">. . .<u>Petitioner </u></span></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="Default" style="text-align: center; line-height: 110%; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt -.7pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; color: windowtext;">=Versus=</span></strong></span></p><p class="Default" style="margin-left: -.7pt; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; color: windowtext;">Nayan and another </span></strong></span></p><p align="right" class="Default" style="margin-left: -.7pt; text-align: right;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; color: windowtext;">. . . <u>Respondents</u></span></strong></span></p></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Penal Code (XLV of 1860)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoTitle" style="margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Section 304</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; tab-stops: right 210.85pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">We find from the FIR that there was no specific allegation of any injury caused by accused Abdul Hannan. Moreover, we find from cross-examination of the informant, who deposed as P.W.1, that he told the <em>Daroga</em> about the injury caused by the accused Hannan to the victim’s head, but the <em>Daroga</em> did not write it. However, there is no evidence on record that the informant took any step against such omission by the <em>Daroga</em>. We did not find any illegality in the finding of the High Court Division that the case against accused Hannan was not proved beyond reasonable doubt. With regard to accused Nayan, the allegation is that he dealt <em>seni</em> blow to the knee of the victim. The High Court Division observed that the occurrence took place as a result of land dispute between the parties. It is admitted by the informant in his deposition that there was land dispute. The High Court Division noted that accused Nayan gave only one blow to the left knee which is not a vital part of the body showing that he did not intend to kill the victim for which the killing cannot be termed as murder. The High Court Division </span></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">concluded rightly that it is not a case of culpable</span></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;"> homicide amounting to murder, but one of culpable homicide not amounting to murder and, accordingly, altered the conviction to one under the second part of section 304 of the Penal Code.  . . .(13 and 14)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.5in; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 1.0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN-GB" style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">For the Petitioner: </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Mr. Khondker Diliruzzaman, Deputy Attorney General instructed by, Mrs. Mahmuda Begum, Advocate-on-Record</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.5in; margin: 0in 0in .25in 1.0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN-GB" style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.5pt;">For the Respondents:</span></strong> <span style="font-size: 11pt;">Mr. Md. Bahar Uddin Al-Razi, Advocate-on-Record</span></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: center; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">JUDGMENT</span></u></strong></span></p><h4 style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27.0pt; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><u><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-variant: small-caps;">Muhammad Imman Ali, J:</span></u> <span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-weight: normal;">This criminal petition for leave to appeal is directed against the judgement and order dated 11.08.2016 passed by the High Court Division in Criminal Appeal No.5185 of 2011 allowing the appeal in part acquitting accused No.2 Hannan @ Hanu of the charge and commuting the sentence of accused Nayan from imprisonment for life to imprisonment of 10(ten) years.</span></span></h4><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The facts relevant for disposal of the case are that   one Md. Azimuddin lodged a First Information Report (FIR) with Palash Police Station on 09.01.2004 against the accused persons alleging, <em>inter alia,</em> that the informant had longstanding land dispute with the accused party and in order to mitigate the same, some respectable persons of the village came forward and settled the same by giving 5 gondas of land to the informant and on 09.1.2004 at 8.00 a.m. the FIR named accused persons made an attempt to construct a road through the middle of the land as given to the informant on <em>salish</em> by cutting earth from both the sides and while the son of the informant went to the place of occurrence and protested, he was assaulted causing serious injuries and in the course of assault, the  FIR named accused No.l dealt a senda blow on the left knee of the deceased and another accused dealt lathi blows on the victim and when the informant and other witnesses went to the place of occurrence, they were also assaulted. After the alleged occurrence the son of the informant was taken to Kaligonj Thana Health Complex, but on the way he succumbed to the injuries and hence, the present case.</span></span></p><p class="Style5" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: normal; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: .1pt 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">3.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The police investigated the case and submitted charge sheet against the accused persons under sections 143/447/323/302/34 of the Penal Code. The case record was transmitted to the Court of the Sessions Judge, Narsingdi, and subsequently it was transferred to the Court of the Additional Sessions Judge, Narsingdi, for holding trial, who framed charge against the accused persons under sections 302/34 of the Penal Code which was read over to the accused persons who pleaded not guilty and prayed to be tried.</span></span></p><p class="Style5" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">4.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Prosecution examined as many as 9 witnesses and the defence examined none.</span></span></p><p class="Style4" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: .15pt 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">5.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">On conclusion of the trial, the Court convicted the appellants (petitioners herein) under section 302/34 of the Penal Code and sentenced them to suffer rigorous imprisonment for life and also to pay a fine of Tk.50,000/- each, in default to suffer rigorous imprisonment for one year more. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">6.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Being aggrieved thereby, the accused petitioners preferred Criminal Appeal No.5185 of 2011 before the High Court Division, which upon hearing the parties was allowed in part acquitting the accused appellant No.2 Hannan @ Hanu of the charge and altering the conviction of accused-appellant No.1 Nayan from one under section 302/34 to one under the second part of section 304 of the Penal Code and modifying the sentence from imprisonment for life to rigorous imprisonment for 10(ten) years.</span></span></p><p class="Style4" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: .1pt 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">7.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Against the judgement and order of High Court Division, the State filed the instant criminal petition for leave to appeal before this Division.   </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">8.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. </span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Khondker</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> Diliruzzaman, learned Deputy Attorney General appearing for the State submitted that the High Court Division upon misreading and misinterpreting the material points on record and relevant law of the case in question most erroneously passed the impugned judgement and order occasioning failure of justice. He further submitted that the High Court Division having not properly perused the evidence on record and on misdirecting itself on the facts and circumstances of the case, most erroneously passed the impugned judgement and  order, which is non-judicial and arbitrary and not sustainable in the light of the facts and circumstances of the case. The learned DAG also submitted that the accused-respondent is connected with the alleged occurrence and the prosecution will be able to prove the same, and the High Court Division miserably failed to consider the same in passing the impugned judgement and order. He submitted that there is specific allegation against the accused-respondent, and the offence was disclosed under that section of law in the light of the facts and circumstances of the case against the accused which the High Court Division miserably failed to take into consideration. He further submitted that the informant, who deposed as P.W.1, told the <em>Daroga</em> about the injury caused by accused Hannan to the victim’s head, but the <em>Daroga</em> did not write it and the High Court Division miserably failed to consider the same in passing the impugned judgement and order.  The learned D.A.G. lastly submitted that the allegation made and offence charged was proved against the accused respondent, which is clearly evident from the totality of the case, which the High Court Division failed to consider, and hence the impugned order is liable to be set aside.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">9.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Md. Bahar Uddin Al Razi, learned Advocate-on-Record appearing for the respondents made submissions in support of the impugned judgement and order of the High Court Division. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">10.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">We have considered the submissions of the learned Advocates for the parties concerned and perused the impugned judgement and other connected papers on record.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 120%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">The two respondents before us, namely accused Nayan and Hannan @ Hanu were convicted by the trial Court under sections <span style="letter-spacing: -0.2pt;">302/34 of the Penal Code and sentenced to suffer</span> imprisonment for life and also to pay a fine of Tk.50,000/- each, in default to suffer rigorous imprisonment for one year more. By the impugned judgement the High Court Division acquitted accused respondent Hannan @ Hanu and altered the conviction of respondent Nayan to one under the second part of section 304 of the Penal Code and reduced his sentence to rigorous imprisonment for 10(ten) years, while maintaining the sentence of fine. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 120%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; tab-stops: 24.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;">11.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">      </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;">The case against accused respondent Hannan @ Hanu as made out before the trial Court was that he dealt a Dagger blow to the back of the head of the victim. According to the trial Court, the witnesses supported such allegation. However, the High Court Division upon assessment of the evidence and materials on record acquitted Hannan @ Hanu because in the FIR, which was lodged within about 7 hours of the occurrence, the informant did not mention that Abdul Hannan caused any injury to the victim. The High Court Division found that the allegation against Abdul Hannan was an embellishment.  </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 120%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; tab-stops: list 0in left 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;">12.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;">We find from the FIR that there was no specific allegation of any injury caused by accused Abdul Hannan. Moreover, we find from cross-examination of the informant, who deposed as P.W.1, that he told the <em>Daroga</em> about the injury caused by the accused Hannan to the victim’s head, but the <em>Daroga</em> did not write it. However, there is no evidence on record that the informant took any step against such omission by the <em>Daroga</em>. Also we note from the cross-examination of P.W.7, the Investigating Officer that the FIR was written by the informant in his own hand. In view of such facts and circumstances, we did not find any illegality in the finding of the High Court Division that the case against accused Hannan was not proved beyond reasonable doubt.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 120%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; tab-stops: list 0in left 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;">13.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;">With regard to accused Nayan, the allegation is that he dealt <em>seni</em> blow to the knee of the victim. The High Court Division observed that the occurrence took place as a result of land dispute between the parties. It is admitted by the informant in his deposition that there was land dispute. The High Court Division noted that accused Nayan gave only one blow to the left knee which is not a vital part of the body showing that he did not intend to kill the victim for which the killing cannot be termed as murder. The High Court Division concluded that it is not a case of culpable homicide amounting to murder, but one of culpable homicide not amounting to murder and, accordingly, altered the conviction to one under the second part of section 304 of the Penal Code. </span></span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 120%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         In the facts and circumstances discussed above, we do not find any illegality or infirmity in the impugned judgement. Accordingly, the criminal petition for leave to appeal is dismissed.</span></p><p class="Default" style="text-indent: 27.0pt; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; color: windowtext;">Ed. </span></strong></span></p><div style="mso-element: footnote-list;"><br clear="all"/><hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"/><div id="ftn1" style="mso-element: footnote;"><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><a href="#_ftnref1" name="_ftn1" title=""><strong><u><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-variant: small-caps;">Crimi</span></u></strong></a><strong><u><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-variant: small-caps;">nal Petition For Leave to Appeal No. 931  of  2016</span></u></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span style="font-size: 9pt;">(From the judgement and order dated 11th  of August, 2016 passed by the High Court Division in Criminal Appeal No.5185 of 2011)</span></span></p></div></div></div></div>

Name="Medium List 2 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="73" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Grid Accent 5"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="60" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Grid Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="63" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 1 Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1 Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 6"/>  <w:LsdException text-align: justify; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Code of Criminal procedure (V of 1898)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 164</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Evidence Act (I of 1872)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 24</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">It reveals from confession of condemned </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.2pt;">prisoner that there was no complaint of police</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;"> torture or any kind of threat before the pw-34 that she was compelled to confess beyond </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">her willingness, if any violence or inducement</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;"> is not made by the police then the confession may be regarded as voluntary.            . . . (37)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Code of Criminal procedure (V of 1898)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.0pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 164</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Evidence Act (I of 1872)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 24</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The presence of a magistrate is a safe-guard and guarantees the confession as not made by influence. When a confession is taken by a public servant there is a degree of sanctity and solemnity which affords a sufficient </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">guarantee for the presumption that everything</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.2pt;">was formally, correctly and duly done. In this</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> case the recording magistrate came forward </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">to give the evidence and there has been found nothing that he failed to give the memorandum</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> as to her confession and pw-34 has been thoroughly cross-examined by the defence as to the genuineness of the confession and memorandum issued by him. It is not necessary that the memorandum as to the </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.5pt;">confession is to be issued separately. It is enough,</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">if it is inserted in the prescribed form but there</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> must be signature of the recording officer which is found present. . . .(39)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Code of Criminal procedure (V of 1898)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 164</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Evidence Act (I of 1872)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 24</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 120%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%; letter-spacing: -0.5pt;">Although the condemned prisoner, subsequently</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;"> retracted her confession by placing written statement at the time of examination under section 342 of the Cr.P.C that she was compelled to confess before the magistrate under threat of torture by police and she being minor was not stable because of being drunk from two bottles of whiskey. But that does not reflect on her confession made by her because such history of confession was unable on the part of any interested quarter to make falsely in such way. No such clue or document is found in the entire evidence of </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">the prosecution case. Moreso, if the confession</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">is found to be true and voluntary, the retraction </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">at a later stage does not affect the voluntariness</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 120%;"> of the confession. The retraction of the confession is wholly immaterial once it is found voluntary as well as true                                   . . .(40)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Code of Criminal procedure (V of 1898)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 164</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Evidence Act (I of 1872)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 24</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">The confession is so natural and spontaneous</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> that one cannot harbor any doubt about its voluntariness. When a confession is found to be true and voluntary and inculpatory in nature without corroborating evidence a conviction can be imposed upon the maker of the statement.    . . .(41)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Code of Criminal Procedure (V of 1898)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Section 164</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Evidence Act (I of 1872)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Section 30</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The confession made by the condemned prisoner regarding killing incident of the deceased has been supported by information </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">provided by Khadiza Akhter Sumi. But</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> this confession of Sumi should not be treated </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">as corroborative evidence. It may be a piece of</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">circumstantial event because such information</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> provided by co-accused in her confession has not been tested on oath. . . . (43)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Interpretation of Statute</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In the case of our criminal justice system </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">there is no provision in law for the offender to</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">reduce the sentence by mitigating circumstances</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> as of right but in practice the judges have powers to determine the punishment to be awarded for an offence. The sentence, with certain exceptions in capital cases, is within the sole discretion of the judges and the judges are determined by discretion to weigh the mitigating factors presented by the defence against the aggravating factors presented by the prosecution. Practice reminds precedents that the death penalty is intended only ‘for the worst of the worst’ crimes. . . . (60)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Interpretation of Statute</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 115%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">This sentence that someone be punished in such a manner is referred to as ‘Death Sentence’, whereas the act of carrying out </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">the death sentence is known as execution. The</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">execution is not only an exemplary punishment</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">alone that can erase the crime from the society</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">forever. Lesser punishments may significantly</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;"> prevent or reduce the crimes from the society depending on the good governance and awareness of the people.            . . . (78)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Code of Criminal Procedure (V of 1898)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.25pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Section 376</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.25pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">We do find extraneous grounds to commute the sentence but we do not find any reason </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.5pt;">to interfere with the conviction recorded against</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> her under section 302 of the Penal </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Code. In the above facts and circumstances of</span></strong> <strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">the case, we are of the view that ends of justice</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> will be met </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">if accused Oyshee Rahman is sentenced to one</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> of imprisonment for life instead of awarding her sentence to death with a fine of Tk. 5,000/- [five thousand].         ...(80 and 81)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 115%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">Islamuddin Vs. State, 13 BLC [AD] 81; State Vs. Munir and another, 1 BLC, 345; Mofti Abdul Hannan Munshi @ Abul Kalam and another Vs. The State, 2017(1) LNJ (AD) 38;</span></em></strong> <strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">Furman Vs. Georgia, 408 U.S. 238[1972];</span></em></strong> <strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">Lockett Vs. Ohio [1978];</span></em></strong> <strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">Zulfiqar alias Bhutto Vs The State [1995 SCMR 1668];</span></em></strong> <strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">Muhammad Ikram alias Billa Vs. The State, 1999 SCMR 406;</span></em></strong> <strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">Muhammad Afzal Vs. The State, 1999 SCMR 2851;</span></em></strong> <strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">Nalu Vs. The State, ALR [AD][2012];</span></em></strong> <strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;">State Vs. Tasiruddin, reported in 13 DLR 203 and State Vs.  Saifullah Al-Mahmood Tanvir and others, 1 LM [AD] ref.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 1.0in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Mr. Sujit Chatterjee with</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 1.0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Mr. Afzal H. Khan, Advocates.</span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 1.0in; text-align: right; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">. . . For the appellant<u> </u></span></strong></span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: right; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 1.0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 9pt;">(In Criminal Appeal No. 10281 of 2015)</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 1.0in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Mr. Zahirul Haque Zahir, D.A.G with</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 1.0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Mr.</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;"> Md.</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;"> Atiqul Haque [Selim], A.A.G and</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 1.0in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Mr. Nizamul Haque Nizam, A.A.G</span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 1.0in; text-align: right; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">. . . For the State<u> </u></span></strong></span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: right; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 1.0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 9pt;">(In Jail Appeal No. 2016 of 2015)</span></em></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">JUDGMENT</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27.35pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Jahangir Hossain, J</span></u></strong> <span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">This Death Reference</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;"> No. 99 of 2015 is the outcome of judgment and order of conviction and sentence dated 12.11.2015 referred to the High Court Division by the learned Judge of Druto Bichar Tribunal No. 03, Dhaka for confirmation of death sentence to condemned prisoner Oyshee Rahman under section 374 of the Code of Criminal Procedure [briefly Cr.P.C]. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Challenging the said judgment and order of conviction and sentence, condemned prisoner Oyshee Rahman filed a petition of appeal being numbered as Criminal Appeal No. 10281 of 2015 and she also filed Jail Appeal No. 216 of 2015. Death Reference and both the <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">said Criminal Appeals have been heard together</span> and are disposed of by this common judgment.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">3.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The prosecution case is briefly described as under: </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: .5in; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">One Md. Moshiur Rahman @ Rubel being informant lodged an ejahar with Paltan Model Police Station, Dhaka after consultation with some of his relatives alleging that his elder brother Mahfuzur Rahman, police inspector, along with his wife Shawpna Rahman, daughter Oyshee Rahman, son Ohee Rahman and maid servant Sumi used to reside at Flat No. 5/B, 2 No. Chamelibagh, Dhaka. On 16.08.2013 Iftekharul Alam, brother-in-law of Mahfuzur Rahman, intimated him over cell phone that Mahfuzur Rahman and his wife were missing and further told him that at about 02:00 am at night on 15.08.2013 his niece Oyshee Rahman had informed her aunt Suborna over cell phone that her parents had gone to Rajshahi and she along with her brother was afraid to stay at their residence without their parents. Oyshee also informed Iftekharul Alam that her brother Ohee was staying with her and she had left maid servant Sumi at the Aftabnagar slum. Being afraid after hearing such information, Iftekharul Alam asked his younger brother Rubel to inquire about them through the security guard of the Chamelibagh house and Rubel informed his elder brother Iftekharul Alam that early in the morning of 15.08.2013 Oyshee, Ohee and the maid servant Sumi had left the house for Oyshee’s aunt Suborna’s Mirpur residence by a CNG auto rickshaw. Iftekharul also told the informant that he had asked many persons regarding the whereabouts of his elder brother and sister-in-law but in vain. Subsequently, Dr. Rayhan, a relative of the informant, made contact with Malibagh office of the Special Branch, workplace of Mafuzur Rahman, who in turn, asked the Palton Model Police Station to look into the matter. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">4.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Thereafter, police of Paltan police station entered the house of Mahfuzur Rahman at about 05:30 pm on 16.08.2013 by breaking the main door of the house with the help of a locksmith and found the dead bodies of the informant’s brother Mahfuzur Rahman and sister-in-law Shawpna Rahman inside a bathroom of their house. Police duly held inquest reports of the dead bodies and sent the same to Dhaka Medical College Hospital for autopsy. Said Dr. Ryhan further asked the informant to come quickly to Dhaka and thereafter the informant rushed to Dhaka same day and found the dead bodies of his brother and sister-in-law lying at the Dhaka Medical College Hospital’s morgue. He also found marks of several injuries inflicted by sharp weapons on the persons of his brother and sister-in-law. The informant further stated in the ejahar that his brother and sister-in-law were killed by some unidentified assailants between 11:00 pm of 14.08.2013 and 04:30 pm of 16.08.2013. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">5.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Having received the ejahar police started Paltan Model Police Station Case No. 13 dated 17.08.2013 against unknown miscreants under sections 302/34 of the Penal Code.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 105%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 105%;">6.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 105%;">Soon after lodging the FIR, police seized some materials and ornaments relating to the death of the deceased and apprehended maid servant Khadiza Akhter Sumi, Mizanur Rahman Rony and Asaduzzaman @ Jony while Oyshee Rahman surrendered to the police station. During investigation of the case, Oyshee and maid servant Sumi made confessional statements before the magistrate under section 164 of the Cr.P.C and seven witnesses also made statements before the magistrate under the aforesaid section. The investigating officer after completion of investigation, submitted police report being charge sheet No. 64 dated 08.03.2014 against the three accused persons including the condemned prisoner under sections 302/201/ 212/ 109/328/380/34 of the Penal Code while separate police report being charge sheet No. 65 dated 08.03.2014 was submitted in Kishore Adalat against Khadiza Akhter Sumi on being minor under sections 302/114/201/380/328/34 of the Penal Code. Except minor Khadiza Akhter Sumi all other accused persons were put on trial by the learned Metropolitan Sessions Judge, Dhaka in Metro. Sessions Case No. 3380 of 2014.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">7.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Learned Metropolitan Sessions Judge, Dhaka framed charge on 06.05.2014 against accused Oyshee Rahman under sections 328/302/201/380 of the Penal Code, accused Asaduzzaman @ Rony under sections 302/109/212/34 of the Penal Code and accused Mizanur Rahman @ Rony under sections 302/34/212 of the Penal Code which was read over and explained to them present on dock to which they pleaded not guilty and claimed to be innocent at the trial.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">8.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">Thereafter, the aforesaid case was transferred</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> to Druto Bichar Tribunal No. 03, Dhaka by a <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">gazette notification dated 21.10.2014. Gravamen</span> of charge was again framed after being amended by the Druto Bichar Tribunal on 30.11.2014 against accused Oyshee Rahman and Asaduzzaman @ Jony under section 302 read with section 109 of the Penal Code and accused Mizanur Rahman Rony under section 212 of the Penal Code which was also read over and explained to them while they were present on dock to which they claimed further to be innocent at the trial. The prosecution in order to prove its case, examined 39[thirty nine]out of 57[fifty seven] witnesses cited in the charge sheet while defence did not call any witness in their favour, but put their case by <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">way of suggestions to the prosecution witnesses.</span> </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">9.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">On closure of the prosecution evidence, the accused persons present in dock, were also examined under section 342 of the Cr.P.C wherein the incriminating evidence and confessions brought to their notices and consequence thereof were explained to them. This time the accused persons present in the dock reiterated their innocence, non-complicity and declined to adduce any evidence in their favour through defence witnesses but accused Oyshee Rahman submitted a written statement depicting that at the relevant time she was 17[seventeen] year old as per her birth certificate as well as passport and having been drunk by taking whisky she went to her friend’s house. During remand she was beaten to state something abnormally before the magistrate, otherwise she would be taken on remand time and again and she knew nothing about her parents’ killing. Her sense was not working properly at that time. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">10.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Considering the evidence including confessions and facts and circumstances of the case, learned Judge of Druto Bichar Tribunal No. 03, Dhaka found accused Oyshee Rahman guilty of the offence punishable under section 302 of the Penal Code and sentenced her to death with a fine of Tk. 20,000/-[twenty thousand] and accused Mizanur Rahman Rony was found guilty of the offence punishable under section 212 of the Penal Code and sentenced him to imprisonment for 2[two] years with a fine of Tk. 5000/-[five thousand], in default, to suffer simple imprisonment for 1[one] month more while accused Asaduzzaman @ Jony was found not guilty and acquitted from the charge leveled against him under section 302 read with section 109 of the Penal Code.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">11.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Md. Atiqul Haque @ Selim along with Mr. Md. Nizamul Haque Nizam, learned Assistant Attorney Generals has taken us to the FIR, inquest reports, DNA test, reports of mental condition of accused Oyshee Rahman and her age, autopsy reports, seizure list, seizing articles, testimony of the witnesses, confessional statements, impugned judgment and other connected documents on record wherefrom it alleges that both the victims were killed by the condemned prisoner from 11:00 pm of 14.08.2013 to early in the morning of 15.08.2013 in a pre-planned manner.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">12.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Having gone through the evidence of all the 39 prosecution witnesses it is found that pw-01 Md. Moshiur Rahman is the informant of the case. Deceased Mahfuzur Rahman and Swapna Rahman were his elder brother and sister-in-law [bhabi] respectively. At the time of occurrence he was in the village home under Mymensingh district. Getting news from pw-20 Dr. Md. Rayhan he came to Dhaka and found the dead bodies of the victims in Dhaka Medical College morgue on 17.08.2013. After that he lodged the FIR, marked as exhibit-01 against unknown assailants. This witness could not provide any evidence against the persons by whom the victims were killed. Simply identification of the dead bodies has been made by him. He heard the occurrence from others and in the FIR [exhibit-01] he stated that his elder brother Mahfuzur Rahman and his wife Swapna Rahman were killed in the house of Flat No. 5/B, at 2, Chamelibagh, Dhaka between 11:00 pm of 14.08.2013 and 04:00 pm of 16.08.2013 but he failed to narrate any single word against the condemned prisoner before the trial court whether she was involved with the killing of the victims. The evidence of this witness is silent with regard to the involvement of the condemned prisoner. Because this witness said he had no personal knowledge subsequently, by whom the victims were killed. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">13.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Pw-12 Md. Amzad Ali who is the manager of the house testified that he made a call over cell phone to the mother of Oyshee who gave permission to allow Oyshee for going outside of the house as she showed interest on 15.08.2013. On 16.08.2013 maternal uncle of Oyshee came and found the door of the flat locked from outside. In his presence and others police broke the lock of the door and found two dead bodies inside Oyshee’s bath room. He signed the seizure list prepared by the police on 22.08.2013. Pw-33 recorded the statement of this witness, marked as exhibit-24, under section 164 of the Cr.P.C on 26.08.2013. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">14.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Pw-13 Md. Shahinur Islam is a security guard who testified that Oyshee went outside when manager allowed her to go on 15.08.2013 in the morning. He could see the door of the flat locked from outside but subsequently relatives of the deceased and the police recovered dead bodies from that flat on 16.08.2013 and he signed the seizure list prepared by the police on 22.08.2013. Pw-35 Keshob Roy Chowdhury, Senior Assistant Judge, recorded statement of this witness, marked as exhibit-29, under section 164 of the Cr.P.C on 26.08.2013. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 109%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 109%;">15.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 109%;">Pw-16 A. Motaleb is also a security guard of the house, who after having breakfast came and saw Oyshee, Ohee and Sumi in front of a CNG. They left with two bags in a CNG on being allowed by manager to go outside on 15.08.2013 in the morning. On 16.08.2013 morning Oyshee informed her maternal uncle that she was in her friend’s house and did not turn out. Oyshee was asked to come but she sent her brother Ohee only. Maternal uncle, Ohee and manager went upstairs and found the door of the house locked. In the afternoon police and other relatives broke the lock of the door with the help of a locksmith and found dead bodies of Mahfuzur Rahman and his wife inside the house. Pw-12 recorded statement of this witness, marked as exhibit-12, under section 164 of the Cr.P.C on 26.08.2013. The evidence of these three witnesses namely pws-12, 13 and 16, who were deployed in the house for security purposes, established the time and place of occurrence wherefrom the dead bodies of the victims were recovered by the law enforcing agencies. Even then, their evidence finds the condemned prisoner at the downstairs’ of the house and the condemned prisoner very tactfully went out of the house showing dramatic and cleverish attitude to the said witnesses. The door of the house was opened with the help of a locksmith, brought by police, which has been supported by pw-14 A. Hannan, a locksmith by profession. He said in his evidence that he was brought to the place of occurrence house by police in order to open the door of the house on 16.08.2013 and he entered the house after breaking the door and found two dead bodies therein. The evidence of these witnesses in respect of recovery of the dead bodies has been corroborated by the evidence of pw-18 Constable Taslim Uddin and pw-19 Constable Mojibur Rahman both were present at the time of recovery of the dead bodies from the place of occurrence on 16.08.2013. On 16.08.2013 morning pw-20 Dr. Md. Rayhan after being informed went to the place of occurrence building where he found Ohee who did not tell him anything correctly but said Oyshee sent him there. Police recovered dead bodies of Mahfuzur Rahman and his wife from their rented flat at Chamelibagh between 04:32 pm and 05:00 pm. This witness heard later that Oyshee was involved with the murder.        </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 30.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">16.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">          </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Pw-17 Iman Ali is a CNG auto rickshaw driver who started running the CNG auto rickshaw from 12:30 pm on 15.05.2013 under instruction of Oyshee from one place to another place in the capital and handed over the auto rickshaw in the garage at 04:30 pm. line-height: 110%;">25.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Pw-27 Tasnim Ferdous is an assistant supervisor of Kishore Sangshodhanagar, Gazipur who found accused Oyshee normal between 24.08.2013 and 31.08.2013 and she used to do daily task in a normal condition. This witness saw nothing abnormal with Oyshee to commit suicide when she was in the said organization. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">26.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Pw-28 Md. Anisul Islam, Sub-Inspector of Detective Branch, visited Khulna Mishuk Clinic on behalf of pw-37 Md. Abu Al Khair Matabber [investigating officer] and seized diary [page 1-424 wherein at page 101 it is written that Swapna Rahman wife of Mahfuzur Rahman of Anjuman Road, Doulatpur, Khulna was admitted on 16.08.1994 at 18:45 hours] and photo copy of license of the said clinic and collected birth certificate of Oyshee issued by Dr. Abdur Rahim in presence of the witnesses and prepared seizure list, marked as exhibit-22. 16.08.1994 is the birth date of accused Oyshee recorded by Mishuk Clinic and its certificate issued by Dr. Abdur Rahman who died on 22.07.2015, have been supported by pw-36 Md. Diderul Islam, Ex-Manager of the said clinic. The birth date of accused Oyshee has also been supported by the evidence of pw-39 Nur Jahan Mery, who deposed that Oyshee was born in her presence at the said clinic on 16<sup>th</sup> August, 1994 and the delivery of her birth was normal.   <strong> </strong></span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">27.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Pw-02 Md. Jony and pw-03 Rakib Hasan are the witnesses of inquest report and seizure list. In their presence inquest reports of both the dead bodies of the deceased were prepared by pw-06 Abu Tahar Bhuiyan, Sub-Inspector of Police, on 16.08.2013 at 17:40 hours. Pw-07 Constable Maleka Begum and pw-08 Constable Mahbub Alam signed the said seizure list and challan of both the dead bodies. Pw-06 also seized many articles including a dagger and some Frence Fries from the house of the deceased on the same day. Pw-29 Md. Jahangir Hossain Sub-Inspector of Detective Branch, pw-30 Md. Golam Mustafa, Sub-Inspector of Special Branch and pw-31 Md. Nazrul Islam, Senior ASP were also present at the time of recovery of the said articles. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">28.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Pw-37 Md. Abu Al Khair Matabbar after receiving the case docket by the order of DC. DB memo No. 1518 dated 22.08.2013 revisited the place of occurrence, re-examined the sketch map with index [exhibit-31] prepared by the earlier Investigating Officer, seizing goods and materials, re-examined witnesses and examined 34 witnesses, autopsy reports, inquest reports, report of assessment for mental condition of Oyshee, DNA test, report of age relating to accused Oyshee and finally submitted charge sheet being No. 64 dated 08.03.2014 against accused Oyshee Rahman, Asaduzzaman Jony and Mizanur Rahman Rony after finding prima facie case and submitted a separate charge sheet being No. 65 dated 08.03.2014 against minor accused Khadiza Akhter Sumi and on 15.09.2014 a supplementary charge sheet being No. 64/1 was also submitted by him.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">29.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Pw-38 Md. Monir Hossain being Sub-Inspector of Horirampur Police Station verified the name and address of accused Asaduzzaman Jony.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">30.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">It appears from documents on record that Dr. Meruna Mahjaben and Dr. Farhana Rahman, Forensic Medicine Department, DMCH clinically examined accused Oyshee Rahman to ascertain her age. Considering findings of physical examination and radiological reports they opined that the present age of accused Oyshee Rahman is around 19[nineteen] years.       </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">31.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In this case Oyshee Rahman and Khadiza Akhter Sumi made confessional statements before the magistrate during investigation of the case. It reveals from the confessional statement of Oyshee that she having brought sedative tablets from the shop blended with the coffee and administered the same to her mother after Magrib prayer and father after around 11:00 pm on 14.08.2013. She stabbed her mother on her abdomen indiscriminately with a sharp knife at about 02:00 am [15.05.2013] after being drunk from two small bottles of whisky in the master bed room. She took her younger brother Ohee inside bath room when he started crying after waking up. She gave jomjom water to her mother when she wanted to drink. Thereafter, she made some more stabs on her mother and then more blows on her neck. Her mother fell on the ground from the bed and died of sustaining wounds.
